alert.note: Alert for Madison; Marshall; Morgan (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 09 at 8:42PM CST by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT WEST CENTRAL MARSHALL...SOUTH CENTRAL MADISON AND SOUTHEASTERN MORGAN COUNTIES THROUGH 930 PM CST... At 841 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles west of Morgan City, or 12 miles east of Hartselle, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40-50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Southern Huntsville, Redstone Arsenal, Morgan City, Laceys Spring, Valhermoso Springs, Farley, Florette, and Whitesburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CST for north central Alabama. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 200 AM CST for northeastern Alabama.
